result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. WILLIAM C MOSELEY

defendant.name: MOSELEY, WILLIAM C
defendant.address: 571 County Road A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941

records.addlTxt: Return date on February 7, 2023 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:40 PM Defendant WILLIAM C MOSELEY in court, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for WILLIAM C MOSELEY.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, mirrors the criminal complaint and emailed a copy to Atty Nelson. Attorney Nelson acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Nelson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on February 7, 2023 at 10:00 AM. Atty Nelson states he will be filing a motion to modify bond.

Court adjourned at 2:43 PM
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Second appearance on November 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:14 AM Defendant WILLIAM C MOSELEY in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF118 and 22CT74. Defendant states he has not applied for the public defender's office. Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one. Court informs defendant that he needs to contact the public defender's office before the Court will look at appointing counsel. 

2022CT74-Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading for 22CT74. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court determines the defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY of his behalf. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.  Court sets both cases for Status of counsel on November 1, 2022 at 2:30 PM.

Court adjourned at 10:18 AM
Second appearance on September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant WILLIAM C MOSELEY in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Def states he does qualify for the public defender. Court schedules Status of Counsel for 22CF118 September 20, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Court will reschedule 22CT74 Adjourned Initial Appearance for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 AM.
Second appearance on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:43 AM Defendant WILLIAM C MOSELEY in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes bond has been set. Statement by the defendant. Court orders bond to continue. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 

Court adjourned at 9:46 AM
